title: The black watch.
author: Picken, Andrew
snippet: away she floats past the imaginative spectator, like the soft and graceful daughter of nature, until the rapid Lyon, issuing from the mouth of a dark but noble glen, which she passes, marries himself to her like an impatient lover ; and impetuously running away with his bride, under the dark hills of Weem, and the braes of Ballechin, only seems to become a really sober mari^ when meandering down the meads of the rich carse of Strathmore.
